result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesus I. Gonzalez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jesus I. Gonzalez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jesus I. Gonzalez was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Revoked - Sentenced to Co. Jail/HOC

02:24 PM Defendant Jesus I. Gonzalez in court, in custody. Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions Defendant on counsel. Defendant has contacted PDs office and has not obtained counsel. Defendant will proceed on own. Court reads on waiver of counsel. Waiver free and voluntary. Defendant in receipt of complaint. Pfeifer/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.

Court sentence-

Jail - 75 days - can serve remainder of time in Oneida or Brown County
Jail credit - 66 days

Appeal rights given.

records.addlTxt:
2:39 pm Defendant Jesus I. Gonzalez in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek states agreement. Plea questionnaire filed. State moves to amend Count 1 to misdemeanor criminal damage to property - Granted. State moves to dismiss Count 2 - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Victim Impact Statement filed-Schiek statement that restitution has been paid in full directly to victim. Schiek/Burns/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 1 year
Fine - $1,000 including costs to be taken from cash bond posted
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Jail credit - 7 days if revoked
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given.
Adj. 2:50 p.m.

ADDRESS INFO for Jesus I. Gonzalez
Current: 1824 Harold St, Green Bay, WI 54301 United States  (Effective: 04-07-2016)
Prior: 1824 Harold Street, Green Bay, WI 54302

3:31 p.m. Defendant Jesus I. Gonzalez in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing in exchange for State amending to misdemeanor charges. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Information has been filed - Burns in receipt of Information - waive further reading - enters not guilty pleas to all counts. Bail continued. Adj. 3:34 pm  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

3:17 p.m. Defendant Jesus I. Gonzalez in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued. Adj. 3:18 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

1:20 p.m. Defendant Jesus I. Gonzalez in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Defendant statement to Brown County incarceration. Schiek statement to bail - Court reinstates cash bond with same no contact provisions. Defendant provides address of 1824 Harrold Street, Green Bay, WI. Defendant states he has driver's license and several vehicles to make court appearances in Oneida County. Adj. 1:24 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
per Mary @ ONSO - in custody @ ONSO
Extradition Forecast - Will extradite
per Judy @ ONSO - on detainer in Brown Cty

2:49 p.m. Defendant Jesus I. Gonzalez not in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court - $1000 paid at Brown County Jail on 9-7-15 - Letter faxed to JA on 9-25 from poster of bond - indicates that defendant in custody in Green Bay - Schiek statement to defendant's whereabouts - unknown - Court authorizes warrant - if in jail in Green Bay Court authorizes detainer be placed.
PC from Ms. Tielens requesting the bond hearing be taken off the calendar.  She will be faxing something over in writing.
Adjourned initial appearance at 11-02-2015 02:30 pm
Bail/bond hearing at 09-28-2015 02:30 pm
Letter re bond sent to Judge Bloom for review
No intoxicants; no taverns.  No entry on premises of Comfort Inn, Rhinelander - if personal possessions are still on Comfort Inn premises - may ask 3rd party to obtain possessions

1:26 p.m. Defendant Jesus I. Gonzalez in court, via video, in custody.  Steven M. Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Michlig statement to bail - Court questions defendant as to residence, length of employment in Oneida County - Court sets $1000 cash  bond.  May request accelerated adjourned initial hearing if unable to post bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 02:30 pm. 1:35 p.m.
